result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel Torres-Ayuzo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Manuel Torres-Ayuzo appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn interpreter Victor Gonzalez appeared by video. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender. Court orders Defendant to file Petition for appointment of counsel. Court schedules Preliminary Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 8:30 AM to be held in person.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:41 AM Defendant Manuel Torres-Ayuzo appeared by video. Sworn Spanish interpreter Victor Gonzalez appeared as interpreter for defendant.   Attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.  Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney.  Witness excused.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No contact directly or indirectly with victims N.C.D., C.H., A.C. or J.M.T.-C., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety.

3:19 PM Defendant Manuel Torres-Ayuzo appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Manuel Torres-Ayuzo.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn Spanish Interpreter Victor Gonzalez appeared by video.  Address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders $250 cash bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victims N.C.D., C.H., A.C. or J.M.T.-C., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Preliminary hearing requested within time limits. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for Monday, October 10, 2022 at 10:30 AM.
